######**_~~ALERT INCOMING~~_**

There seems to be some confusion regarding what classifies as pixel art so let's try to clear things up a bit.

**_*~~Pixel Art~~*_** is a **deliberate effect created on a pixel level**. _***~~Pixellation~~***_ is a product of low resolution. Pixel art is always pixellated, but a pixellated image or drawing is not always pixel art. Drawing/painting at a low resolution can be a good start, but it is not inherently pixel art.
                                                                                                        .
___

######**_~~EXAMPLES~~_**

https://i.imgur.com/OPyXfzi.png?noredirect vs https://i.imgur.com/zVq54DV.png?noredirect

A good way to distinguish them if you are unsure is to take a step back.

https://i.imgur.com/m9nQGhG.png?noredirect vs https://i.imgur.com/EkTeg6a.png?noredirect

Pixel art isn't art painted at a low resolution to make it pixellated, it's art created (or refined) on the pixel level. More pixels (higher resolution) means more work to refine the effect, and pixel art generally follows the "less is more" policy.
Does it mean I'll submit it 1350 by 1080 or 150 by 120 (multiplied/divided by 9)?

You can submit in 150 x 120 :)

It's the shape that matters not the size.

Does this:
 
"This artwork must be in 1350x1080 (or multiples of) aspect ratio." 

Mean that the piece could be portrait? I haven't wrapped my mind around the concept of 'or multiples of'. 

Cheers!

Like Mashuun said :) Multiples as in 2700 x 2160 is just as valid as 675 x 540. We keep trying to think of a better way to say it, but basically, we're looking for a specific shape, not necessarily a specific size, and different programs use different metrics so we're trying to keep it as universal as possible without being confusing. 

This also means that no, this cannot be a portrait piece, it must remain landscape.

It means you can multiply it / divide both sides, keeping the same ratio. For 1350x1080, that is 5:4.

For pixel art, you would want to do it in something like 360 x 288, which is still 5:4 ratio, then upscale once finished.

My question is I linked my art, but can I continue to modify my entry on that same link? When is the cut-off you would collate all the entries?

I do believe we left the "edit after submission" option available. If you lost the link, you can also just resubmit your artwork and we will use the latest valid entry (though please don't do this too much as it increases the judging time :P).

The cutoff for edits or resubmits is the same as the contest closing.
